Reviews.Title: Love my Thrive!!
Reviews.Author: ~T~
Reviews.Content: I did my homework before purchasing this phone and even after reading some bad reviews here and some good reviews elsewhere I decided to purchase anyway. Being an android there are many ways to get it to do exactly what you want. If you aren't technically savvy there are several Android Forums you can scan and get info on how to root this phone and many other apps that can make it the perfect phone. I purchased from Ross Cellular and although it didn't come with the extras that would normally come stock it was brand new and in perfect condition. Within a few hours I had the phone rooted, apps installed for maintenance, and running pretty nicely. I am still tinkering with it but find I am actually using it more than my laptop these days. Overall I am very pleased with this purchase! And happy that I chose this particular phone over many others :)

Reviews.Title: LG Thrive-Honest Review
Reviews.Author: Kate
Reviews.Content: I purchased this phone about a year ago and was impressed immediately by it. Of course, this phone makes it a great first timer on smartphones. Everything you read on the good reviews is the honest truth. Occasionally it may glitch up, but there is certain apps that you get to fix that problem. Do the research for it! The only bad part for this phone (the reason why i put 4 instead 5 stars) is that i dropped it out of my lap getting out from a truck and it hit the ground with the case on and the screen to this day is black with lines running through it. I was so lost when that happened, but i am thinking about purchasing another one of these phones because even though it did not work after that drop, i did drop it quite a few times and it still worked. Anyways, people this is the phone to buy. I've looked at several other phones, but the reviews and the phone itself just doesnt match up to this one it seems like.

Reviews.Title: My favorite phone.
Reviews.Author: Alecio
Reviews.Content: I have had over 4 phones and this by far is my favorite. It has android which is really nice and has a very responsive touchscreen. I did not buy this on Amazon however, I bought it at BestBuy.

Reviews.Title: Very Durable Phone
Reviews.Author: H. L. Wilson "train manic"
Reviews.Content: I bought this as my first Android SmartPhone, it seemed like a reasonable priced phone, so I bought it. About 6 months after I purchased it, I dropped it into a glass of milk. I took it out and dried it off, ( putting it into a bowl of rice helps ) it still worked! I have also dropped this phone MULTIPLE times but the screen never cracked. Scratches do show up on the phone itself, but not the phone screen. But then, I made a bad mistake for leaving it in my pocket when I went swimming. I finally realized that I had it in my pocket and took it out.  I looked at the screen and it said: "Emergency Mode" I didn't know what that meant, but i did the same thing as before.  I left it in the rice bowl for a week, and it still worked!! It's an amazing little phone, I would totally recommend this to anyone looking for their first smartphone.

Reviews.Title: Exactly What I Was Looking For
Reviews.Author: Rocketman
Reviews.Content: Excellent entry level smart phone. Just enough features and functionality for someone who doesn't want the commitment of a contract with AT&T; but is satisfied with basic phone, texting, games, and Internet access. Not fancy, but just what I was looking for.

Reviews.Title: Great Basic Android Phone
Reviews.Author: Greg
Reviews.Content: I purchased two of these phones two years ago, since it was the only Android prepaid phone I could find under $200 (all others at the time without a contract were outrageously priced at $500+ and in my opinion still aren't worth $500+). I paid $150. Once I started using the first one I bought for me, my wife used it a few times and well I had to buy a second. We've never had a problem with either phone.The phone (calls) works well and I've not really had a problem with reception and have never had a dropped call. The speaker phone is okay. It isn't the most powerful I've owned, but it good enough for most situations.Browsing the internet on wifi is quite good, but not as fast as newer phones. 3G was good while I had it, but AT&T; dropped their prepaid by-the-KB plan, so I haven't used it since (year or so). When traveling, wifi hot spots are so prevalent today (hotels, restaurants, etc.), I found 3G was not really necessary (convenient yes, but not enough to warrant the current cost). If you are impatient and have to have the latest smartphone, this isn't the phone for you.The screen is responsive and provides good display quality, including watching movies.Each has been dropped multiple times, and aside from the small dings in the case, they function as the day we bought them.The GPS works, although I haven't used it a lot. Just a few times to get my bearing in new locations or the outdoors/woods.Phone memory is limited, so the app quantity is limited, but I bought it for basic Android functionality, and it has exceeded all my expectations (Angry Birds works well on this phone). I don't update to the latest versions of applications and memory capacity is fine (newer versions of things like Maps are 10-15MB vs. 3MB). As I didn't really see any value while using the updated versions, I uninstalled the updates and kept the base versions.The camera takes decent pictures, and when there isn't another camera available, the quality is acceptable (just understand you aren't going to be making high quality large prints, but will get high quality small prints). It's much better than missing the picture in a pinch.

Reviews.Title: Cant hot spot or tether
Reviews.Author: Darktown Pagan 1%er
Reviews.Content: I liked phone but being a unlocked ATT phone I was not able to tether or use as hotspot. Wasted my money...

Reviews.Title: 505 Thrive Android smart phone
Reviews.Author: Gary1957
Reviews.Content: I shopped with amazon and they had a wide range of different phone all of them were very nice I found the one I wanted and was looking for the LG. 506 Thrive android and bought it with ease threw amazom it.s.a great phone for me I had a 505 phinex and both were just what I wanted in a smart phone

Reviews.Title: BAD PHONE
Reviews.Author: Lisa
Reviews.Content: I HAVE HAD THIS PHONE FOR 1 YEAR AND THEY ARE NO GOOD THE PHONE CUTS OFF IN THE MIDDLE OF A PHONE CALL YOU CAN BE TALKING ON THE PHONE AND YOU CAN HEAR YOUR WORDS COMING RIGHT BACK TO YOU

Reviews.Title: Great Phone
Reviews.Author: frogz07
Reviews.Content: I finally decided to upgrade to a smartphone. I bought one from here had a terrible experience. I sent it back and got this phone. This phone is great. I wod definitley reccomend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Nice Phone
Reviews.Author: D. Brown "donelle1"
Reviews.Content: Only issue with this phone is it has a small screen so can be difficult to see some things.  Otherwise works great and received it quickly.

Reviews.Title: no att sim card
Reviews.Author: meg clark
Reviews.Content: phone crashed with update and had to be sent back to LG after one week of use still waiting to use my new phone

Reviews.Title: Good enough 'droid phone for those who don't want/need large screens.
Reviews.Author: Rob Wehrli
Reviews.Content: This phone appears to have everything that I want and regularly use.  I've been using one of these for about a year.  It certainly has its flaws, but it seems to be fairly robust and doesn't drain the battery too fast.  It is a bit heavy for its size and it is relatively slow, but it mostly works :)

Reviews.Title: Love the Phone ... battery runs out quickly
Reviews.Author: Becky A. Tillberry "Becky T"
Reviews.Content: The phone works great ... just concerned about the battery going down so fast all the time ... which means have to charge it all the time and is inconvenient

Reviews.Title: Fine Android Phone for AT&T;
Reviews.Author: PhotoAgent101 "seeker of quality products"
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone for less than $125.  It worked just fine.  Android is a fine platform for phones.  I used this on the AT&T; GoPhone network.  I did not do a lot of websurfing, just used the phone for emails and phone calls.  Both worked just fine.

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: Ryan
Reviews.Content: I have had this phone for a year, got it through at&t; for $150 and it works great. The touch screen is not glass like and responses very fast to a touch. The battery last all day without wifi on and no major texting or calling. I wish I could upgrade the platform on it so i wouldn't have to get a whole new phone.

Reviews.Title: I really like my phone
Reviews.Author: On the hill "Laurie"
Reviews.Content: I have had my LG Thrive since Dec.2011. I really like it. I haven't had any problems with it. If you use your home's wifi or hot spots you won't burn up your data. Just turn off your 3G... It will automatically turn off to when connecting to your wifi.I have listened to Pandora for hours through my wifi.I find the phone easy to use. Once I read the manual. I am also on it more than my computer. I have a few apps on it from the Android market. I find them very useful. The camera also takes excellent pictures! The only thing negative I would say is I would like to delete somethings (apps) on it that I will never use. It seems I can not...  I would recomend this phone.

Reviews.Title: It was used and not a brand new phone!!!
Reviews.Author: Moreira
Reviews.Content: When the package arrived, I noticed something wasn't right. I had the same phone before, which I had bought at Best Buy and the packaging from the first phone was completely different, much nicer. The back cover seemed like it had been repainted or replaced with one with a rougher surface. The charger wasn't the original one and the worst thing, it didn't even work!! So, I had to buy another charger which cost me almost $30.00. It also seemed used, and wasn't supposed to have been. Nothing was in its original packaging. I was very disappointed and do not recommend this seller.

Reviews.Title: Trash!! No INTERNAL MEMORY!! Stopped working less than 1 year...
Reviews.Author: Gustavo
Reviews.Content: First, the mobile was delivered by the vendor without charger...Second, the internal memory is 160Mb... you install some apps and spend the rest of time without memory to receive sms...Third, it stopped working in 10 months... and doesn't receive calls.Never buy it! That's my recommendation...

Reviews.Title: don't fall for it
Reviews.Author: Lamy
Reviews.Content: worse phone i've ever bought for years. It didn't last me 3 weeks and I never dropped it or abused it.

Reviews.Title: Data expensive.
Reviews.Author: Tony Manuel
Reviews.Content: The only bad thing was data. It goes really fast. 25 dollars for 500mgbytes sucks. I was spending 100 dollars month extra. Its crazy. Other than that its a wonderful phone.

Reviews.Title: Worthless phone from the seller
Reviews.Author: Chandra
Reviews.Content: Normally LG Thrive mobile phone comes with the package of 1) internal SD memory card  2) headset  3) blue tooth set  4) USB data cable 5) software 6) chargers  7) battery. I expected the same when I order from US Wireless. But I have not received any of the above items other than chargers and battery from US Wireless. Normal user expect the same when they order which comes as a package from LG.I am very disappointed by making this order from US Wireless as per one of my friend's suggestion. I should have received all the above said items if I purchased from LG store. I made a mistake by this order.

Reviews.Title: I can't seen to download any music on this phone!!!!
Reviews.Author: mamaroo
Reviews.Content: I just got this phone. Its ok I'm not that impressed with it. And i am so disappointed. On the app they give you cant for music. you can't get any good songs. I want music people. If its music you want. Than this phone is not for you!!!"" This phone sucks!!!!!"!"

ProductInfo.Features:
3.2" TFT capacitive touchscreen, 256K colors
3.15 MP (2048x1536 pixels) camera w/ autofocus, Geo-tagging and video capture
Android OS, v2.2 (Froyo)
600 MHz ARM 11 CPU featuring Qualcomm MSM7227
Built in FM radio
ProductInfo.Name: LG Thrive P506 Unlocked GSM Phone - Silver
